prior_knowledge_digest: Students should have a basic understanding of language structure, including nouns, verbs, and adjectives in English. Familiarity with the concept of conjugation and declension is helpful but not required. The focus will be on introducing the Latin alphabet and pronunciation, as well as simple greetings.

lesson_flow.description: Begin with a warm welcome and introduce the day's objectives.
lesson_flow.student_action: Listen and respond to the teacher's greeting.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Set a positive tone for the class.

lesson_flow.description: Introduce the Latin alphabet and its pronunciation.
lesson_flow.student_action: Repeat after the teacher and practice pronunciation.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Use audio clips to reinforce correct pronunciation.

lesson_flow.description: Practice basic Latin greetings using flashcards.
lesson_flow.student_action: Participate in pair activities to practice greetings.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Encourage students to use correct pronunciation.

lesson_flow.student_action: Reflect on what they learned and ask questions.
